data.title: Denglerfuneralhome, Author at Dengler Funeral Home
data.text:
G. Charles “Chick” Carey, 87, of Boynton Beach, FL, formerly of Amity Twp., Berks Co., PA, passed away peacefully on Saturday, June 2, 2018, at Bethesda Hospital East. Born in Kingston, PA, he was the son of the late Granville M. and Alverna (Brown) Carey. He was the widower of his beloved Helen Anne (Bartholomew) Carey.

Chick was employed in maintenance for 25 yrs. at the former Firestone Tire & Rubber in Pottstown, PA. He then worked outside maintenance at Penn State-Berks Campus for 12 yrs., retiring in 1993.

He was a member of St. Paul’s UCC in Amityville where he was instrumental in the renovation of the chapel and an integral part of the religious community.

Surviving Chick are a daughter, Bonnie C. Kosmerl, wife of Edward J. Kosmerl, Jr., of Palm Beach, Florida and a son, Richard C. Carey, husband of Stacy Carey, of Reiffton, PA; a granddaughter, Dr. Kristin M. Kosmerl of Palm Beach, FL, and a sister: Verna Reigle wife of Herbert Reigle, Exeter Twp., PA.

Charles was predeceased by a sister, Norma F. Wright.

A Funeral Service will be held on Friday, June 8, 2018 at St. Paul’s UCC, 1312 Old Swede Rd. Douglassville, PA 19518 at 11:00AM. A viewing will be held from 10:00 AM – 11:00 AM before the service at the church.

Interment will be held in St. Paul’s Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to St. Paul’s United Church of Christ at the above address.

John “Jack” Henry Detweiler, 88 of Exeter Twp., Berks Co., PA passed away on Monday, June 4, 2018, at Reading Hospital & Medical Center in West Reading, PA.

Born December 18, 1929 in Pottstown, PA, he was the son of the late John Detweiler and the late Edna (Gauger) Detweiler. He was the husband of the late Pauline (Figaniak) Detweiler.

Jack was the former Owner of Jack & Sons Auto Body, Birdsboro, PA. from 1969 to 1992

Surviving are sons; Gerald J. husband of Joyce Detweiler of Birdsboro, PA, Perry P. husband of Debra Detweiler of Exeter Twp., PA, daughters; Patti D. wife of George Zook of Birdsboro, PA, Jacqueline (Detweiler) Hinkel of Reading, PA, companion; Barbara Soos of Exeter Twp., PA, 7 grandchildren; John, Jenna, Ian, and Brett Detweiler, Kara Hinkel, George and Jeremy Zook, 3 great grandchildren; Vivian, Carter, and Lilian.

He was predeceased by brothers; Marvin and William Detweiler, and sister; Kathryn Marsteller.

Memorial contributions may be sent to Animal Rescue League, 58 Kennel Rd., Birdsboro, PA 19508 and/or American Heart Association, 212 E. Broad St., Bethlehem, PA 18018.

A visitation will be held at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc., 144 North Spruce Street, Birdsboro, PA 19508 on Saturday, June 16, 2018 from 10:00AM to 12:00 Noon.

Franklin I. Clouser, 88 of Birdsboro, PA passed away on, Monday, June 4, 2018, at the Penn State Health St. Joseph’s.

Born in Laureldale, PA, he was the son of the late George L. and Elizabeth D. (Wolf) Clouser. He was the loving husband of Doris G. (Rea) Clouser.

Frank was a member of the Union Lodge 479 F & AM, Birdsboro Fire Co., Scottish Rite Cathedral, Birdsboro Sportsmen’s Club, and Birdsboro VFW Post 411.

Surviving along with his wife, Doris, are 1 son: David L. Steinmetz of Reading, PA; 1 daughter: Kathy A. wife of Paul R. Weller of Douglassville, PA; 1 brother: Paul Clouser, husband of Ruth of Bernville, PA; and 1 sister: Carolyn Clements, widow of Ralph of Bernville, PA. He is also survived by: 2 grandchildren: Scott Weller, husband of Tanya and Jenna Weller, and 3 great-grandchildren.

Frank is predeceased by 4 brothers: George, Norman, Donald, and Frederick Clouser; and 3 sisters: Bertha Greth, Sarah Crossland, and Kathryn Lape.

A Masonic Service will be held on Saturday, June 9, 2018 at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508 at 10:30AM, the funeral service will start promptly after. A viewing will be held from 9:00 AM – 10:30 AM before the service.

Interment will be in Birdsboro Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions, may be to the Union Lodge 479 F & AM, c/o Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. at the above address.

Carolyn Stella (Wernicki) Walt, 82 of Amity Twp., Berks Co., PA passed away on, Saturday May 26, 2018, at the Mifflin Center, Cumru Twp., Berks Co., PA

Born in Reading, PA, she was the daughter of the late Zygmond Wernicki and the late Mary (Gajewski) Wernicki. She was the loving wife of Donald L. Walt.

Carolyn was a graduate of Central Catholic High School and employed as a Sales Manager for Card-o-Rama / Hallmark, Exeter Twp., PA before her retirement in 1998. She was a member of St. Mary’s Roman Catholic Church, Reading, PA.

Carolyn will be greatly missed by her friends and family whom she enjoyed spending time with.

Surviving along with her husband, Donald, are 2 sons: Scott A. Walt of Flying Hills, PA, Bryan M. husband of Kim Walt of Exeter Twp., PA, 2 daughters; Donna L. widow of Clark Schnable of Douglassville, PA, Lori J. wife of Gary Raser, Jr. of Birdsboro, PA, 7 grandchildren, and 2 great-grandchildren.

A memorial service to celebrate Carolyn’s life will be held on Thursday, May 31st from 5:30-8pm at the Church of St. Benedict’s, 2020 Chestnut Hill Road, Mohnton PA 19540.

Flowers may be sent to the church or memorial contributions may be made to the American Diabetes Association, 2451 Crystal Drive, Suite 900, Ar-lington, VA 22202 www.diabetes.org

Mary Ellen (Everhart) Messner, 90 of Robeson Twp., Berks Co., PA passed away peacefully on Wednesday, May 23, 2018, at home surrounded by her loving family.

Born in Robeson Twp., Berks Co., PA, she was the daughter of the late Howard J. Everhart and the late Alice (Kurtz) Everhart. She was the widow of Howard John Messner.

Mary Ellen graduated from Birdsboro H.S. class of 1946, and later graduat-ed from Bryland Beauty School. She was a beautician and homemaker. She was a member of St. John’s Lutheran Church, Gibraltar, PA.

Surviving are son; Ricky G. Messner life partner of Coleen Heffner of Birdsboro, PA, daughter; Beverly E. wife of Thomas J. Riegel of Birdsboro, PA, sister; Thelma Griffith of Maple Grove, PA, grandson; Bryan husband of Sophie Riegel, and great-granddaughter; Mila Riegel.

She was predeceased by 3 brothers: Raymond, William, and Charles Ever-hart and 1 sister; Hazel Keen.

A viewing will be held from 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM followed by a funeral service on Saturday, May 26, 2018, at Dengler Funeral Home, 144 N. Spruce Street, Birdsboro, PA at 10:30 AM.

The family would like to thank “her Girls” for their loving care.

In lieu of flowers contributions may be made to Berks VNA –Hospice Care, 1170 Berkshire Blvd Wyomissing, PA 19610

Donald William Gentile, 80 of Birdsboro, PA passed away on Sunday, May 20, 2018, at his residence. Born in Scranton, PA, he was the son of the late Vito Gentile and the late Stella (Lesenski) Gentile.

Donald was employed as a Machine Engineer for Birdsboro Corp. from 1972 to 1986. He last worked at Carpenter Technology. He was secretary of South Birdsboro Archery Rod and Gun Club.

Surviving are 2 sons; Matthew P. Gentile husband of and Rosa Lara of Reading, PA, Michael A. husband of Nikole Gentile of Douglassville, PA, daughter; Christine M. Gentile of Hummelstown, PA, 5 grandchildren; Luke, Kayla, Adam, Vito, Gabriella, and 1 great-granddaughter; Emma.

Services will be held at the convenience of the family.

Gladys (Shirey) Hartman, 79, of Elverson, PA passed away on May 20, 2018 at Columbia Cottage in Wyomissing, PA.

Born in Kulptown, PA, she was raised by her grandparents, the late David and Alice (Ruppert) Shirey. She was married to James J. Hartman.

Gladys worked in the cafeteria for the Twin Valley School District for many years. Gladys was known as “the cake lady,” she always enjoyed decorating cakes. She was a member of St. James Lutheran Church in Geigertown, PA and she was past president of the American Legion, Colonel Jacob Morgan Post 537.

She is survived by 2 sons: James C. Hartman, partner of Robin O’Neil of Birdsboro, PA, John A. Hartman, husband of Michelle of Birdsboro, PA; 1 daughter: Alice G. Fabian, wife of Ronald of Sellersville, PA; 1 half-brother: David Shirey of Geigertown, PA; 10 grandchildren; and 5 great grandchildren.

A funeral service will be held on Friday, May 25, 2018 at 11:00 AM at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508. A viewing will be held on Friday, an hour before the service at the funeral home from 10:00AM – 11:00AM

The interment will be held in Elverson Methodist Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to Safe Berks, 255 Chestnut Street, Reading, PA 19602 or online, https://www.safeberks.org/donate/.

Gertrude R. (Wisniewski) Watts, 90, of Geigertown, PA passed away on May 18, 2018 while she was happily looking at the orchids with her granddaughter at French Creek State Park.Born in Birdsboro, PA, she was the daughter of the late Chester and Frances (Nowak) Wisniewski. She was the widow of Malcolm K. Watts, with whom she shared 65 years of marriage.

Gertrude was a graduate of Birdsboro High School, Class of 1946 and enjoyed gathering with her remaining classmates at the Breakfast Hut. She enjoyed gardening, cooking, crocheting, reading and writing, and had a great sense of humor. She was a very special mother, Nana, and aunt to everyone.

She is survived by 1 son: M. David Watts, husband of Carolyn of Geigertown, PA; 3 grandchildren: Bonnie, John, and Chelsea; brother-in-law: Richard Wloczewski; and many adoring nieces and nephews.

Gertrude was predeceased by 5 siblings: Dorothy Drevicki, Chester Wisniewski, Jr., Bernice Holmes, Rose Rossi, and Theresa (Tessie) Wloczewski.

A funeral service will be held on Thursday, May 24, 2018 at 10:00 AM at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508. A viewing will be held on Thursday, an hour before the service at the funeral home from 9:00AM – 10:00AM The interment will be held in Birdsboro Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to Friendship Fire Co. No. 1 Geigertown, PA, PO Box 209 Geigertown, PA 19523.

Joanne Carol (Krall) Trupp, 56 of Birdsboro, PA died on Saturday, May 12, 2018, at Cooper University Hospital in Camden, New Jersey. Born November 2, 1961 in Reading, PA, she was the daughter of the late Floyd Cyrus Krall and Joan C. (McMullen) Ahrensfield of Douglassville, PA. She was the wife of Kevin Trupp.

She was employed by Exeter Greens, Exeter Twp., Berks Co., PA

Surviving along with her husband and mother are son, Justin L. husband of Melissa Trupp of Bernville, PA, daughters, Ashlee M. wife of Huy Phan of Cinnaminson, NJ and Adrienne M. wife of Matthew Romig of Lower Alsace Twp., Berks Co., PA, brother, Barry Krall of Douglassville, PA, sister, Debbie King of Robeson Twp., Berks Co., PA; 2 granddaughters Emelia and Shea.

She was predeceased by brother, Joseph Krall.

The family will receive friends from 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM on Friday, May 18, 2018, at Dengler Funeral Home, 144 N. Spruce Street, Birdsboro, PA.

A Funeral service will be at 3:00 PM at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc.

Memorial contributions may be sent to Miller-Keystone Blood Center, 2745a Leisczs Bridge Rd., Reading, PA 19605.

Dengler Funeral Home, Inc., Birdsboro, PA is in charge of the arrangements.
